intro: Weinmannia dulitensis, commonly known as the Dullit's weinmannia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology, featuring serrated margins and a palmate arrangement. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often found at the tips of branches. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is typically found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
